text: CLOSE ON LOCKE, sitting on the beach -- lost in his own thoughts -- SNAPPED OUT by the sound of VINCENT barking. looks over at... WALT, holding VINCENT back as the dog strains at his leas A groggy MICHAEL sits next to him.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 2.
Walt, ya gotta keep that dog quiet.
I dunno what’s the matter with him. (pulling on leash) C’mon, Vincent-- Cut it out... Michael offers an apologetic look to Shannon and Boone, a feet away.

Sorry... SHANNON tsk with annoyance. BOONE nods, understandingly. We get QUICK POPS of some of the other regulars, stirring awake to the commotion: SAYED, CLAIRE, HURLEY, JIN and SU etc. That’s when we find... JACK, already up. And staring at something. KATE appears from behind and sidles up next to him.
What is it? She follows his gaze to see he’s looking at THE FUSELAGE. From inside we hear NOISES - banging around dull thuds.
Somebody’s in there.
Everybody in there's dead.
(under his breath) Sawyer.

Standing right behind you, jackass. Jack looks back over his shoulder to, indeed, find SAWYER Then, turning back, and with a deep breath, Jack takes ou his itty-bitty PENLIGHT. He moves off toward the opening the ruined fuselage.

Jack...?  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 3. ON SAWYER - he throws a smirking glance to Kate, as he wh out his MEGA-WATT FLASHLIGHT. Kate rolls her eyes, then follows Jack. Sawyer follows her. Much schmuck-baiting as Jack nears the opening of the wreckage, and Locke folds into the group from the other s The others in the camp hang back. REVERSE ANGLE - the four arrive at the opening and peer i The banging and noises are louder now. And we see somethi in the foreground... something NOT HUMAN moving inside. ON SAWYER - Waiting for Jack to make a move. Then, out of patience...

How ‘bout I shed a little light on-- Sawyer switches his lamp on and attempts to bring it up, SHARP GRUNT is heard from inside the fuselage, and Jack blocks his arm. PUSH IN to the darkness inside the cabin as we can just m out... CLOSE-UP - SOMETHING’S HEAD turning to look at them. Moonlight glinting of its feral, furious eyes as it snort CLOSE ON JACK - Staring back at it... Without turning, he says to the others in a quiet, but urgent whisper:
Run.
44 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 4.
Continuous. The others barely have time to act on Jack’s suggestion when Sawyer shines the flashlight inside.

No! From inside... SHRIEKS! THREE SMALLISH SQUEALING BEASTS come barreling out of the fuselage, fanning out in different directions. Kate SCREA as they run, and the camp is thrown into chaos. Random shouts of: “Look out!,” “What’s happening?!,” “Get away!,” etc., as some flee, some cower, others bring up m shift weapons to defend themselves as the creatures charg past them - including HURLEY, who wields a diving FLIPPER
Aww crud, now what? ON JIN, brandishing a piece of driftwood as he commands S
(in Korean) Stay down. She obeys, staying crouched behind him. In the melee, one of the fleeing CASTAWAYS run right into CHARLIE, knocking him down onto a jagged piece of wreckag

Hey-- Oww! On the ground, Charlie looks at the gash across his forea then glances up and reacts as A BEASTIE closes in on him. ON CHARLIE - Terror rising. At the very last second, he’s YANKED to his feet, flinching, as a BLUR OF FUR flashes b He glances back to discover it was JACK who pulled him out of the animal’s path. They both t just in time to see the RUSTLING OF BRUSH as the beasts disappear into the jungle. ON SAYID, shouting to the others.
It’s alright! They’re gone!  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 5. ON BOONE, who’d been shielding a wigged out Shannon.
You okay?
Yeah. Way to go, Ace. ON CHARLIE and JACK...
What the bloody hell was it? ON LOCKE, nearby, staring off, stoically, in the directio the departing animals.
Boars.
We have to get rid of the bodies. WIDEN to see him conferring with Kate and Sayid as he dre Charlie’s wound.
What, bury them? There’s a whole bunch in there--
More than twenty. Digging will be difficult without shovels or--
Not bury. We have to burn them. The other three react, taken aback by that. Jack notices
What?
They’re people. -- I know they’re people, Kate...
Burning the remains... They deserve better than--  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04

Than what? Getting eaten by wild animals? ‘Cause that’s what’s gonna happen. Any bodies we bury won’t stay buried for long. Look, I know it seems harsh. But that fuselage, in the sun, it’s not about what they deserve... (softening) They’re gone. And we’re not. Sayid looks at the ground, shaking his head.
What you say may be true. (looks back up to Jack) But it’s not right. For us to decide how these people are laid to rest, with no regard to their own wishes -- their religions-
We don’t have time to sort out everybody's God.
Really? Last I heard, we're positively made of time.
Charlie... -- What? I’m just saying...

Hey, I’m not happy about it either. But the plane crashed a thousand miles off-course. They’re looking for us in the wrong place. If they're even still looking. (then) It’s been four days. Nobody's coming. The remainder of this registers on Sayid’s face.
In the morning, we need everybody to start collecting wood... Dried brush... We’re going in turn that fuselage into a furnace.
Crematorium, you mean.  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 6A. Jack looks at her. And nods. Starts to exit, STOPS --  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 7.
We'll wait until the sun goes down tomorrow night to set the fire. Kate nods as Jack goes. As the others start to disperse, Charlie looks at Kate...
If he’s so eager to get this done, why’re we waiting ‘til...
He’s hoping somebody’1l see it. She crosses off as Charlie takes that in...

The sun peeks out over the empty ocean. Another day. 47 EXT. BEACH — DUNE —- MORNING 47 ON A PILE of METAL PIECES, STRIPPINGS, WIRES and AIRPHONE WITH CORDS. Nearby lies the TRANSCEIVER from the cockpit. As a HAND reaches in and picks up a wire, TILT UP to find SAYID, carefully wrapping the wire around a cylindrical p of piping attached to a curved piece of metal.
Guess I’m not the only one who didn’t sleep last night. He glances up at her, then goes back to work.
There are better uses for my time than collecting firewood.
(gets his meaning) You don’t agree with Jack. Sayid doesn’t answer her, just goes about his business. KATE (CONT’D) What're you making?
Too soon to talk about. Not sure if it’1ll even work.
48 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 8.
You're trying to pick up the signal, aren’t you? The one we heard on the transceiver. Bingo. Reluctantly, Sayid nods.
If the French woman's transmissions have truly been playing on a loop for sixteen years, then there must be a power source on this island. A significant one.
You can find it?

Hypothetically... yes. (beat) I’m making an antenna, of sorts. With a few of these mounted at different points on the island, I may be able to use the transceiver to triangulate the signal. Find out where it’s coming from.
What can I do to help?
This is only a prototype. Testing it now may be premature...
Then it’s a good thing I test well. Sayid eyes her for a moment. Smiles. A moment. Then --

Appears you’re as anxious to get off this island as I am. Boy, don’t we know it. Off Kate... EXT. BEACH — MEANWHILE 48 ON MICHAEL, collecting wood near the edge of the jungle. Walt sits nearby, petting Vincent, who’s tied to a tree. suddenly catches sight of HIS POV - LOCKE, sitting in the sand, unlocking a SUITCAS and lifting the lid toward camera, masking what’s inside. ee OF
* oF a es  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 9. ON WALT, he gets up and starts to walk off. Michael sees out of the corner of his eyes.
Where you going, man?
(busted) Nowhere. MICHAEL looks over at LOCKE, now rummaging through the suitcase. WALT (CONT’D) I just thought... I wanted to go see what Mr. Locke's doing.

How ‘bout you help your dad with the wood, okay? (beat) I’m sure Mr. Locke doesn’t want a kid hanging around him all day, anyway. Walt is obviously not keen on that option, but he grudgin begins to pick up sticks --
At least he talks to me. That STINGS -- but it’s kinda true, too.
Okay. lLet’s talk then. What you wanna talk about?

Forget it. As Walt sulks, Michael casts another wary eye at Locke, before picking up a final piece of wood and crossing back the fuselage, where we find... JACK, a bandana around his neck, supervising as various others bring over wood and brush. He takes Michael’s delivery and passes it along to a chain of two other MEN inside the cabin, also wearing something across their fac He casts a wary eye over at  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 10. HIS POV - A SMALL GATHERING of four or five CASTAWAYS talking, occasionally peering over. Among them is Claire, who looks at Jack, then peels away and crosses to him.
Excuse me. Doctor...?
Jack. Claire, right? (re: her belly) How’s the...?

Good. He’s good. (beat) I think maybe you should see this. She hands Jack some folded, partially SINGED papers. As h unfolds them... CLAIRE (CONT’D) Somebody found it. (pointing to the fuselage) In there. They’re collecting belongings. JACK'S POV - The pages contain hand written notes accompa by COLOR PHOTOS OF A HAPPY, YOUNG COUPLE, lovely bridal g a luxurious beach resort, floral arrangements, etc. CLAIRE (CONT’D) They're weeding plans. (pointing, reading) “Steve and Kristen’s.” They were on the plane. Sitting a couple of rows behind me. I remember ‘cause... (a little overcome) They looked... so happy. Jack quickly returns the pages to her, awkward under the weight of her raw emotion --
I-- I don’t understand, Claire, what am I supposed to do with--
I thought... Well, some of us were wondering if maybe we should do some kind of... thing. Like a memorial service or something. You could lead it...
49 50 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 11.
Uh, no, I don’t think...
It’s just a few words. Or maybe we could just read off names. From the passports or driver’s licenses-- Jack’s had ENOUGH --
Look -- It’s not my thing. Claire instantly backs off. Clear to her (and us) she’s pushing a button that best ain’t pushed --
Oh. Okay. Then... maybe I could do it.

Yeah. Sounds fine. Whatever everybody wants. And with that, Jack walks off. As Claire watches him go.. EXT. BEACH - EDGE OF THE JUNGLE —- MEANWHILE 49 ON BOONE, collecting wood... He looks up as JIN, crosses by, his arms also laden with wood. They noti each other. After a moment, Boone offers:

Hi. Jin returns the greeting with a friendly nod and moves of Boone crosses to a piece of driftwood high on the beach, suddenly sees ROSE, sitting far down the beach, near the surf, by herse REVERSE - CLOSE ON ROSE, just sitting, staring out at the sea, gently caressing the gold band she wears on a string around her neck. We can make out BOONE in the deep background.

ON SHANNON, doing a crossword puzzle in the back of an airline magazine, as others continue to toil around her. see BOONE dump off his wood by the fuselage and cross to  "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 12.
That woman's still sitting out there.
(barely listening) Uh huh.
Her husband was on the plane. In the back.
Great.
Are you even listening to me?
What’s a four-letter word for “I don’t care?”
She hasn’t moved from that spot since yesterday, Shannon. (beat) Somebody should go talk to her.
I nominate you. (weary sigh) Taking care of the whole freakin’ world, one person at a time.
Not the whole world. Just my sister-- -- Who was doing just fine until you came along.
Yeah! You had it all together. That’s why I had to fly seven thousand miles to rescue your ass. (then) Face it, Shannon. You'd be lost without me.
Correction. I am lost with you.
LOST "Walkabout" (PINK) 7/22/04 13.
Yeah, well, at least you know you won’t starve with me to take care of you.
I’m not gonna starve... -- Yeah? What’re you gonna eat?
(shrugs ) Ocean’s full of fish.
Hate to break it to you, but the ocean’s not gonna take your gold card. And now Shannon finally puts down her magazine. It’s ON -

You don’t think I can catch a fish? Boone’s look at her says it all. Nope. Before she can respond, their attention’s drawn to... ANGLE ON SAWYER and HURLEY, yelling on top of one another Hurley keeps reaching for the backpack in Sawyer’s hands. Sawyer shoves him away. As they quarrel, ten or fifteen castaways converge on them.

-- hand ‘em over -- There's -- How ‘bout ‘no’ other people here, or don’t Well, maybe if one of us you give a crap -- didn’t eat more than his fair That’s bull and you know it -- share, wouldn’t be a short Dude, what’s your Problem?! -- Hey, I’m peachy, pork-pie. Not happy unless you’re You’re the one-- screwing over-- Boone enters the fray, trying to calm the situation.
Okay, guys, knock it off. C’mon --
Stay outta this, Metro--
What's going on?  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 14. Sawyer, Hurley and Boone look over to see JACK, KATE and SAYID pushing past some of the onlookers.
(indicating Sawyer) Jethro here’s hoarding the last bags of peanuts.
It’s my own stash. (nodding to fuselage) Found ‘em in there.
(to Hurley) What about the rest of the food?

(to Hurley) There is no rest of the food, dude. It’s gone. We kinda... ate it all. The castaways start to murmur: “No food?” And PANIC begin to seep in. People are really starting to get scared. The KNOWERS doing their best to maintain order --
Okay, everybody calm down... -- We can find food. There are plenty of things on this island to sustain us. ON SAWYER, who casually leans against a row of detached airplane seats.

Oh yeah? And exactly how are we gonna get this... sustenance? THWACK! A good-sized knife suddenly imbeds itself in the empty seat next to Sawyer. He flinches back, startled. ON JACK, KATE and the others as they turn toward the direction from which the knife had come to see LOCKE.
We hunt. Stop. Let it sink in. The pure AUTHORITY of this man. After a moment, Kate steps toward him...  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 14A.
How'd you get that knife on the plane?  LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 15. Locke eyes her a moment... then shrugs.
I checked it. Jack PULLS the knife out of the seat. For a second we thi he might keep it... but instead, he offers it to Locke, h out. Sizing up this guy for the first time --
Either you’ve got good aim... (looks to Sawyer) Or bad aim, Mr...?
Locke. His name’s Locke.
Okay. So what is it we’re hunting, Mr. Locke? SLOW PUSH IN ON LOCKE as he speaks...

We know there are wild boar on the island. Razorbacks by the look of them. The ones who came into camp last night were piglets... A hundred, hundred and fifty pounds each. That means there’s a mother nearby. A two-hundred and fifty pound rat with scimitar-like tusks and a surly disposition, who’d love nothing more than to eviscerate anything that comes near her... ON JACK, eyeing Locke as he continues...

... Boars’ usual mode of attack are to circle around their prey, charge from behind. So I figure it’1ll take at least three of us to flank one of the piglets, distract it just long enough for me to pin it... and slit its throat. Everyone stares at him, stunned for a moment. turns to Jack --
And you gave him his knife back. Then Sawyer  51 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 16.
If you’ve got a better idea...

Better than three of y’all wandering into the magic forest to bag us a hunk ‘o ham armed with one 1’il bitty knife? Hell no! That's the best idea I ever heard! With the barest of smirks, Locke takes a step toward his black bag lying nearby and deftly KICKS open the lid. REVEAL, strapped to the lid, HALF A DOZEN LARGE HUNTING KNIVES, of various shapes and sizes, along with other hun accountrements: fishing line; snake-bite kit; etc. The others REACT. Fuck.
Who is this guy?
CLOSE UP ON LOCKE, in crisp white shirt and tie, jotting something down in an open file. Suddenly his phone TRILLS Locke picks it up:
» (into phone) Yes?
(on the phone) Col. Locke, is this line secure? Locke’s eyes dart off for a moment, before he pushes a bu on his phone console.
Line secure, GL-12. Go ahead.
(on the phone) Target area is acquired. Maneuvers are a go for thirteen hundred hours. Repeat -- we are a go.
Roger that. We’1ll convene at the usual rendezvous point at -- * oF a ee ae  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 17.
Locke! Locke looks up from his call and we reveal... RANDY, an office supervisor, standing at the entrance to Locke’s cubicle. That’s right, Locke’s a mid-level management cubicle jock
I told you. I need those TPS reports finished by noon today. Not twelve-thirty. Not twelve- fifteen. Noon! Locke, evenly, though clearly peeved:
I heard you the first time, Randy. As Randy starts to leave, he adds:
And no personal calls during office hours. Colonel. Randy moves off, barely suppressing a snicker and we're.. CLOSE ON LOCKE, his eyes narrow, watching him go...
52 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 18.
CLOSE ON A KNIFE, glinting in the sunlight. Widen to see Kate holding it, looking it over, before she slides it in her belt and continues gearing up she hears:

So you’re hunting boars now, huh? She turns and sees Jack. Hint of a smile. This will alway be their dynamic -- concern baked under the fluffy crust CHEMISTRY neither can deny. As they WALK AND TALK --
Who says this is my first time boar- hunting.
Uh huh. Tell me something -- How come anytime there’s a hike into the Heart of Darkness, you sign up? You know what’s in there.
Actually, I don’t. And we can see that Kate is kinda scared... VULNERABLE, e
But at least I’ve got some experience, right? Jack smiles. She can handle herself. So he turns his attention across the beach towards -- LOCKE, filling his VEST with stuff from his suitcase...
What's your feel on our new friend?
Seems to know what he’s doing.
Call me paranoid, but anyone who packs a suitcase full of knives...
(smiles ) If I didn’t know better, I’d say you were worried about me, Jack. ee eH OF * oF
LOST "Walkabout" (YELLOW) 8/2/04 19.

If I didn’t know better, I’d say you've got a problem staying in one place very long, Kate. (beat) So you wanna tell me why you’re really going? Kate stops. She’s busted. Eager to break this awkward moment, Kate makes sure they’re far enough away from the others -- Opens up her pack, revealing SAYID’S ANTENNA.
Sayid gave me this so he can triangulate the distress signal we heard -- Find the source.
(realizing) This isn’t about boars. She smiles as she refastens her bag and hoists it, does h best to cover her nervousness with bravado --
What can I say? I’m a vegetarian. She moves off. Jack watching her go. 53 EXT. ANOTHER PART OF THE BEACH —- MEANWHILE 53 WALT’s pleading with Michael who shoves things into a pac
But why can’t I come?
Because I said so -- At that moment, Michael notices SUN crossing by, holding plants she’s apparently dug up. He attempts to communicat with her pantomimicaly as he introduces himself --
Uh, hi. I’m, uh, Michael. Mi- chael. My name.
(gesturing to herself) Sun.  LOST "Walkabout" (YELLOW) 8/2/04

“Sun.” Sun... That’s-- that’s nice. Uh, listen, Sun... I’m... I... am going off... off... away... to hunt... And I was wondering... if you you could keep an eye on my boy... Walt... Y’know... Watch him for me... Until I get back...
Sun looks somewhat apprehensive at first, then, after a moment’s thought, she nods and speaks in Korean:
54 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 20.
I will gladly look after your son.
Sorry... I don’t understand Japanese, but -- You’re cool with this, right?
(smiling shyly) Yes. And I'm Korean.
I don’t need a baby-sitter...
C’mon, man. Vincent needs you here, okay? As Walt sulks, Michael adds:
And cheer up. This’1ll give me a chance to get to know your friend Mr. Locke a little better. With that, he heads off to join Kate and Locke, as they m off into the jungle.
Try not to worry about your father. He will be all right.

Yeah, whatever. EXT. BEACH —- MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY AREA —- MEANWHILE 54 ON CHARLIE as he sits down in a quiet secluded spot, look around to see the coast is clear, then takes out his bag dope. Clearly about to take a hit, then... REVERSE ANGLE - BEHIND HIM as a pair of shapely legs come into frame. Feeling someone’s presence, Charlie turns his head and peers up at SHANNON, the sun backlighting her, haloing her head.
Hi.
Uh, hello. Shannon, right?  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 21.
Yeah. (her best smile) You doing anything right now?
Oh, um... (shoving the bag into his pocket ) N-no, not really. At the, uh... He gets to his feet. CHARLIE (CONT’D) What are you doing now?
I was just gonna take a walk. Wanna come?
Er. Yeah. Sure. They head off down the beach. Charlie glowing from the attention. After a beat...
Can I ask you something?
(grinning) I was wondering when you were gonna get ‘round to it. Yes. I’m the bass player from Drive Sha--
Do you know anything about fishing?
What--? Charlie halts, caught off-guard. Then, off her expectant look, he clearly lies, sputtering out:

Fishing? Oh, yeah... My granddad used to take me, taught me everything he knows... knew -- He’s dead god rest his soul -- Anyway, I’m, like, a... fishing fiend. (beat; confidently) England’s an island after all, in’it?
He HK  55 56 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 22. OFF SHANNON’s pleased look...

ANGLE ON A WHEELCHAIR laden with wood, being pulled by a CASTAWAY and delivered to -- JACK, a bandana across his mouth and nose, feeding wood a dried brush into the fuselage. As the Castaway moves off, leaving the wheelchair, Boone approaches.
Doc? Got a sec?
Just call me Jack... What’s up? Boone points down the beach. Jack looks. HIS POV - Rose, still sitting out there.
Woman’s been sitting by herself. I don’t think she’s had any food or water. Guess she’s having trouble dealing... Y’know, about her husband. Think maybe you could go and talk to her or something?
Why me? I’m not a psychiatrist. Maybe you should...
I just figured you might want to ‘cause, well... (beat) You're the one who saved her life. As Jack looks off in Rose’s direction, considering...

CLOSE ON a tree trunk, the bark rubbed off. A hand reache into frame, feeling the scarred grooves in the trunk. WIDEN to find Locke, in expert tracker mode, squatting ne to the tree. He reaches down, brings up some loose soil. Kate and Michael in the background. Kate steps toward Loc
Find something?
+e OF  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 23. He gives her a cursory glance, then tosses the dirt, stan

Ground here’s been rooted up. That’s how boars get the majority of their food. Digging. Afterwards, they generally wallow in the dirt, rub up against trees -- (pointing out tree scars) --Scoring them with their tusks.
O-kay. So what’s all that mean?
Means we‘re close. He starts to move off, as Kate falls into step with him.
Mr. Locke, how is it you-- (smiles; then) Sorry... You have a first name?
It’s John.
John Locke. Like the philosopher. Locke eyes her, appreciatively. That grin --
Like the philosopher.
(searching her memory) “Good and evil, reward and punishment, are the only motives to a rational creature...” She sees Locke and Michael just looking at her, suddenly becomes self-conscious.
Minored in college.
Great. And I got an art degree. (looking around, ironic) Who says higher education doesn’t prepare you for the real world?  57 58 LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 24.
And where’d you learn all this stuff, John? Tracking, hunting... Locke continues to look at her before answering...
Well, let’s just say I’ve had time to minor in a few things myself. LOCKE continues on, moving past frame as we stay with Kat and Michael. They follow several steps behind.
(sardonic, re: Locke) Huh. International Man of Mystery. As they pass frame...

ON ROSE, still sitting stoically, staring out as an airli blanket is suddenly draped over her shoulders. She doesn’ respond or look up as Jack sits down next to her. He hold out a half empty bottle of water:
Hi. Rose, right? Remember me? Seat 23A? Getting no response from her, he adds, wryly:
I’m the guy that told you not to worry about the turbulence. Rose doesn’t even look at him.

Everybody’s getting kinda worried about you. If you want to be alone, that’s fine, but you need to take care of yourself. You really should drink. (no response, he sighs) Okay... We don’t have to talk. Let’s just sit. For a while. And they do. In silence.
ON KATE and MICHAEL - MOVING -- She glances at him, then.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 25.
Your son -- How’s he handling all this?
Hell of a lot better than I am.
You must be proud. He’s a brave kid.
Yeah. Can't take credit for that -- I wasn’t part of his life, ‘til his mother passed away. Two weeks ago.
Oh, I’m sorry -- I didn’t--
That’s okay. They were living in Sydney the past couple of years. I flew out last week. To, y’know... get him. (beat, he looks at her) What were you doing in Australia? ON KATE. Uh oh. Thankfully --

Shhhhh... They halt and look to find themselves in a FIELD OF TALL GRASS. Kate and Michael FREEZE as Locke signals -- “It’s right there.” And sure enough, we see -- FLASHES of dark fur as what must be a BOAR moves through tall grass. GRUNTS. SNORTS. And shit -- it’s CLOSE. LOCKE turns toward Michael and Kate and tries to signal t silently, to flank the boar... KATE starts to move up, close to Locke, but MICHAEL, eage challenge Locke's authority, is resistant to comply.
(whispering) Quit giving us the steal sign. Damn pig doesn’t even know we’re-- A LOUD SNORT as --
59 LOST "Walkabout" (BLUE ) 7/20/04 26. SOMETHING EXPLODES FROM THE TALL GRASS. IT’S BIG. FLASH O

head_text.subj: FUR AND TUSK AS IT CHARGES

text: Locke grabs onto Kate, pulling her out of the way of the charging BOAR. The animal sideswipes LOCKE hard, sending spinning to the ground... And continues to charge at

as he goes down -- Kate picks herself up a few feet away -- the GRUNTING AND SNORTING still all around them -- and makes her way to he Michael. CLOSE ON LOCKE, down on the ground, dazed -- we’re in his head space again (dream-like, SLO-MO), much like we saw h in the teaser. He props himself up and sees HIS POV - Kate reaches Michael, obviously HURT. As we continue to hear the angry SNARLS of the boar. BACK TO LOCKE as he turns his attention to... HIS FEET. Just like in the teaser. He hasn’t lost a shoe, but he doesn’t appear to be wiggling his toes, either. CLOSE ON LOCKE, continuing to stare at his legs, the soun around him fading, as we hear:
Move...
CLOSE ON WARREN, forty-ish, short-sleeve shirt and tie.
You've got to move, Colonel... Your troops are across enemy lines. And time’s running out. REVERSE ON LOCKE, sitting across from him, unperturbed.
Patience -- a quality you lack, GL- 12 -- is the hallmark of a leader.  LOST "Walkabout" (PRODUCTION DRAFT) 7/15/04 27.

Really...? CUT OUT to reveal they’re seated at a table in a small of BREAKROOM -- VENDING MACHINES line one wall. On the table a GAME BOARD - A flat map of the world, with color- differentiated army figures grouped in different areas. Locke’s boss RANDY stands over them, holding a clipboard
Hallmark, huh? Tell me more about being a leader, Locke. Locke looks at him with muted annoyance, then takes a lar bite from his sandwich as Randy pulls up a chair and sits
And while you’re at it, explain the deal with this “Colonel” thing? Perused your file in Human Resources... You’ve never been in any armed forces.
Uh, hey, John... Ya wanna move? I gotta get back to the mailroom--

-- get over here -- gimme a hand -- ON LOCKE, glancing over at JACK, who turns and sees him:

ON LOCKE - His eyes drift over to something past the crow HIS POV - THE WHEELCHAIR, a short distance from the burni fuselage, resting idle and empty. CLOSE ON LOCKE, as a small smile curls the corner of his lips.
